Top-3 Scripts:
so_19757808: man scp | grep port

scp [-12346BCpqrv] [-c cipher] [-F ssh_config] [-i identity_file] [-l limit] [-o ssh_option] [-P port] [-S program] [[user@]host1:]file1 ... [[user@]host2:]file2
     -P port
             Specifies the port to connect to on the remote host.

scp -P 1337 user@remote:foo.txt .

Explanations about Options.-3:
Copies between two remote hosts are transferred through the local host. Without
 this option the data is copied directly between the two remote hosts. Note that
 this option disables the progress meter.
Explanations about Options.-P:
Specifies the port to connect to on the remote host. Note that this option is
 written with a capital ‘P’, because -p is already reserved for preserving the times
 and modes of the file.

Explanations about Options.-M:
Places the ssh client into “master” mode for connection sharing. Multiple -M
 options places ssh into “master” mode with confirmation required before slave
 connections are accepted. Refer to the description of ControlMaster in
 ssh_config(5) for details.
Explanations about Options.-N: Do not execute a remote command. This is useful for just forwarding ports.
